method.text: Peel and halve the bananas both widthways then lengthways. Place in a shallow dish, pour over the rum, lime juice and sugar. Cover and leave to macerate for 1 days, turning occasionally.
Place the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, milk, egg and butter in a food processor or blender. Process until smooth and well mixed.

Remove the bananas from the macerating liquid. Drain off any excess liquid. Toss in the flour to lightly dust. Pour the batter into a bowl then dip each piece of banana into the batter to coat well then place in a wire basket.

Heat the oil to 180°C / 350F in a large saucepan or deep fat fryer. Then fry the banana fritters in the basket for 3-5 min or until crisp and golden. Drain well on kitchen paper. Sprinkle with caster sugar before serving.
